meanings.definition: To provide lodging or space for someone
meanings.sent1: The hotel can accommodate up to four guests in each room.
meanings.sent2: Our house can accommodate all of our relatives during the holidays.
meanings.sent3: The tent tried to accommodate the entire family, but it was too small.
meanings.sent4: The garage was able to accommodate all the cars for the event.
meanings.sent5: The cruise ship can accommodate thousands of passengers comfortably.

meanings.definition: To fit in with the needs or wishes of someone
meanings.sent1: I can accommodate your request for an earlier meeting time.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant was happy to accommodate the customer's dietary restrictions.
meanings.sent3: The schedule was able to accommodate the last-minute changes without any issues.
meanings.sent4: The team was flexible and able to accommodate everyone's preferences.
meanings.sent5: The teacher always tries to accommodate different learning styles in the classroom.

meanings.definition: To make adjustments or changes to suit someone's needs
meanings.sent1: The company will accommodate your work hours to help with your commute.
meanings.sent2: She accommodated her presentation to include the new data that was just released.
meanings.sent3: The tailor had to accommodate the dress to fit the bride perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The chef accommodated the recipe to cater to the vegan guests.
meanings.sent5: The hotel staff accommodated the room temperature to the guest's liking.
